alert.note: Alert for Howard; Mitchell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 4:57PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Mitchell and southeastern Howard Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 457 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Forsan, or 15 miles southeast of Big Spring, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Big Spring, Coahoma, Forsan, Sand Springs, Big Spring Country Club and Big Spring McMahon-Wrinkle Airpark. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 172 and 191. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for western Texas.
